question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Management units can use this section to promote high-quality projects and manage financial institutions participating in investment and financing, ensuring that overall investment and financing work proceeds efficiently and orderly. Specific functions should include financial institution management information, project financing service classification, project financing information inquiry, and project financing promotion.

2.2. Project Financing Service Classification
Classify projects according to their industry, field, and other relevant information, and match different financial institutions based on these classifications. Through this classification matching, when projects need financing, they can quickly match with financial institutions that align with the project characteristics.

Based on the requirements, generate a project financing service classification using Vue2+Element UI.

checklist.title: Is the project financing classification system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code accurately implements a comprehensive classification system using Vue2+Element UI. Check if it includes industry categories, sub-fields, and relevant project attributes with proper hierarchical relationships. Score 0 if no classification structure exists, 5 if only basic industry categories are implemented, and 10 if it includes a complete multi-level classification system with validation logic.

checklist.title: Is the financial institution matching algorithm implemented?
checklist.description: Review the matching algorithm that pairs projects with financial institutions based on classification criteria. The algorithm should consider multiple factors (industry preference, investment range, risk appetite) and provide weighted scoring. Deduct 5 points if matching is based on only a single attribute, 3 points if there's no optimization for match quality. The full score is 10 points for an algorithm with comprehensive criteria and ranked results.

checklist.title: Is the classification-based search and filtering system implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the UI provides advanced search and filtering capabilities based on the classification system. It should include multi-condition filtering, faceted search, and the ability to save search preferences. Deduct 5 points if only basic search is implemented, 3 points if search history is not persistent. Award full 10 points for a comprehensive system with performance optimization for large datasets.

checklist.title: Is there a project-institution matching visualization component?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes data visualization elements (charts, matrices, etc.) showing the matching between projects and financial institutions. It should display matching strength, comparison views, and historical matching patterns. Score 0 if no visualization exists, 5 if only basic charts without interaction are implemented, and 10 if it includes interactive visualizations with drill-down capabilities.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty search results, network errors during data fetching, invalid classification inputs, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered recommendation system 2. Real-time industry trend indicators 3. Interactive matching simulation tool). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar classification methods 2. Function modules unrelated to financing services (e.g., social media sharing without business value) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations in data tables). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating classification logic/UI components/data services), unit test coverage, and Vue component reusability. Deduct 5 points if prop drilling is overused instead of proper state management; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no component documentation exists. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching suitable for financial application (professional blues and neutrals) 2) Proper layout spacing in Element UI components 3) Professional typography with clear hierarchy for financial data. Deduct 3 points for each inconsistent UI component, 5 points for poor information density in classification displays, and 5 points for hard-to-read financial metrics. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to professional financial application standards: 1) Immediate feedback when selecting classification criteria 2) Smooth transitions between different classification views 3) Clear visual cues for matched financial institutions. Deduct 5 points for sluggish classification tree rendering, 3 points for jarring transitions between views, and 5 points for confusing navigation between classification levels. The full score is 10 points.
